Can you check other places?
Convert this to a loop. We don't use streams in the runtime since it has a performance impact.
Do we really need this check? This method is called for resource functions only.

Yes, but this is called for both HTTP and WebSocket resource functions. Since the service typing support is not available yet, this method is used to check the first function parameter to distinguish it.

Shall we change this to the same format as the standard incompatible types error message?
dlog.logDiagnostic(Diagnostic.Kind.ERROR, param.pos, "incompatible query param type: expected 'string|string[]', found '" + param.type + "'";
Also, the expected type can be stated as string|string[] right? Also, how would the user know what type(s) to use for query params?
Another point, in error messages, we use ' around type names, not `

Changed the error as suggested.
If we stated the type as string|string[], user can misinterpret is as a union type as ballerina has similar syntax.
The types of each param are mentioned in the module.md. Also, we can add it to the annotation docs if suitable

Yeah assuming we only allow either string or string[] I also think string|string[] could be misleading.
How about
"incompatible query param: expected a param of type 'string' or 'string[]', found '" + param.type + "'"
On  a separate note, does "query parameter" sound odd? QueryParam for the annotation is OK, but I was wondering if we should use "parameter" for the error message.
Same comment as above here, regarding error message format, use of unions and formatting
Use ' instead of ` to quote types
Check in other places as well
